service.name: Rural Procedural Grant Programme
service.description:
The Rural Procedural Grants Program (RPGP) supports GPs who provide procedural or emergency medicine services in rural and remote areas to attend relevant training, focusing on skills maintenance and up-skilling.  Grant payments are designed to help with the cost of attending training, including course costs, locum relief and travel expenses. Grants are calculated on the number of days of training.
The department maintains a register of eligible GPs and makes payments to GPs on advice from the ACRRM and RACGP.
